pages.text: I have managed to fashion tools and weaponry out of the souls of the dead... Before I had told myself that this is wrong. And while it seems rather cruel, unethical, and downright depraved at first, but if you think about it, you are giving these beings a purpose beyond death. That can't be a bad thing, now can it? In any case, all of these tools are indestructible, so they should prove useful.

pages.text: A blade forged from Soulium is able to sever the link between the body and soul of anything slain by it, effectively making it drop one on every kill. $(4)I believe it may have another use, however...
A pickaxe forged from Soulium will flood energy into the soul of those slain by it, which greatly increases the number of dropped items. It also allows the wielder to reach farther.

A spade forged from Soulium has an interesting effect on insects, arthropods, and the like. Upon attacking one, it seems to apply some form of massive downwards force upon them. This usually kills them instantaneously. It also allows the wielder to reach farther.

pages.text: An axe forged from Soulium rips through flesh and bone with ease, but this property seems to work especially well on the undead. It also allows the wielder to reach farther.
